did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia Finance Committee records

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club. The Finance Committee was one of the original Standing Committees, with responsibility for auditing Treasurer reports and suggesting ways and means of increasing revenues or limiting expenditures. The Finance Committee oversaw the Operating budget, Permanent Fund, and Pension Plan.

scopecontent.p: The records include: minutebook, 1893-1910; ledgers, 1913-1963 and 6/1989-6/1997 (40 volumes); auditors examinations and reports, 1912-1962; monthly financial reports, 1925-1949; beverage supply, 1948-1949; Survey of Operations, 1950; Pension Plan and 1956 budget recommendations, 1955; and miscellaneous minutes (1983-1987), financial statements (1980-1981), and budget, 1995-1996.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
